item.title: Capitalism: You Wouldn’t Trade it for Anything
item.description: These are political days, and hot takes on capitalism are everywhere. Jeff Bezos doesn’t pay enough in taxes, Modern Monetary Theory (MMT) is good, inflation is good, and the #1 problem with kids these days is they don’t read Marx. At least that’s what my TikTok feed would have me believe.

item.title: How I accidentally took down GitHub Actions
item.description: Last December, I was invited to a private bug bounty program to test a beta version of GitHub Actions. GitHub Actions is a workflow automation tool integrated with GitHub. One common use case of GitHub Actions is for CI builds – a project can fairly easily start up a Docker container every time they push a commit (e.g.), and run their project’s tests in the container.

item.title: Automated Hydroponic System Build – Projects
item.description: Hydroponic farming is a method of growing crops without soil, with the main benefits of environmental and nutrient control, water conservation, and reduction of labor. This technique relies on a number of technologies that the principles of automation can be applied in order to improve yield and consistency. In this article and accompanying video, I’ll show you how to built a hydroponic system with basic components and automate it using the open source software Mycodo running on a Raspberry Pi single board computer.
item.author: (Kyle Gabriel)

item.title: The Amazon Personal Games Policy Is Ridiculous
item.description: Software engineer James Liu has revealed the Amazon "Personal Games" policy, a set of onerous restrictions on hobbyist game developers working at Amazon.

item.title: Fair Use via Machine Learning
Building a website without becoming a ‘soydev’
item.description: You will always hear of large media companies crying about how piracy is killing their industry, even if the evidence for these claims are uncertain with some studies claiming small positive, small negative or near-no affect to sales of media, depending on the type of that media.

item.title: Why I Had to Migrate from MongoDB to PostgreSQL
item.description: A few months ago, I made WeWatch, a mobile app to help you find what films to watch. I made the decision to use MongoDB because of the popularity of the MERN stack.

item.title: From Node to Ruby on Rails - D U N K
item.description: I learned to code in the Javascript stack [1] and am building a Javascript based product [2]. I never questioned this stack: many companies default to it, JS everywhere seems good, and the community is big. But for my new side project I decided to try Rails because despite some perception that Ruby on Rails is ‘over’, people in HN comments say it was somehow more enjoyable than the newer Node based stack.
